newsitem.title: USA: U.S. rig count up 20 to 905 in latest week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. rig count up 20 to 905 in latest week.

text.p: The number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the United States stood at 905 as of March 21, up 20 from the prior week and 185 above the year-ago total of 720, Baker Hughes Inc reported.
The number of rigs drilling on land rose by 23 to 757, while rigs working offshore dipped by four to 122.

The number of rigs active in inland waters rose by one to 26. Among the individual states, the biggest changes occurred in Texas, which was up by 19, Oklahoma, which was up by eight, and Louisiana, which was down by eight.
The Gulf of Mexico dipped by four to 117.

A total of 379 rigs were exploring for crude oil, up 13 from last week. The number of rigs searching for gas was unchanged up by eight to 525, while the number of miscellaneous drilling projects dipped by one to just one.
There were 191 rigs drilling directionally, 73 drilling horizontally and 641 drilling vertically.
In Canada, the number of working rigs was down 18 at 377 versus 266 a year ago.
The weekly rig count reflects the number of rigs exploring for oil and gas, not those producing oil and gas.
